itemizedlist.listitem: When processing some form data in VSPs, there may be errors in the PL code (for example due to deadlock condition).

listitem.para: The most popular way of catching the SQL errors is to declare an exception handler.

itemizedlist.listitem: To simplify VSP production, the error handler can be written in a common file and included in each page.

listitem.para: The external file can be included using the following markup:

refsect1.title: Deadlock Example
refsect1.para: The first example demonstrates the creation of a universal deadlock handler. If this file is included in any VSP the deadlock condition will cause a retry up to 3 times on an operation that follows the handler. The VSP simulates the deadlock situation by signalling the error. The error handler is therefore called.

refsect1.title: Calculator with error handler
refsect1.para: The second example is the vs_b_3 Calculator example. In this example there is an added handler to trap errors such as division by zero, and entering characters instead of numbers.
